qas.question: The Times is based in what major British city?
What year did the initial incarnation of The Times start?
What was the original name of The Times before changing its name?
The Times, owned by News UK, is itself owned by what major corporation?
The Times and its sister paper The Sunday Times are published by what company?
What year did The Times change its name from The Daily Universal Register?
What year did The Daily Universal Register initially start?

context: The Times is a British daily national newspaper based in <a0_0>London<a0_0/>. It began in <a1_0><a6_0>1785<a6_0/><a1_0/> under the title <a2_0>The Daily Universal Register<a2_0/> and became The Times on 1 January <a5_0>1788<a5_0/>. The Times and its sister paper The Sunday Times (founded in 1821) are published by <a4_0>Times Newspapers<a4_0/>, since 1981 a subsidiary of News UK, itself wholly owned by the <a3_0>News Corp group<a3_0/> headed by Rupert Murdoch. The Times and The Sunday Times do not share editorial staff, were founded independently and have only had common ownership since 1967.
